page.title: San Francisco / Northern California Emmy Awards

revisions.rev:
{{Infobox award | name = San Francisco/Northern California Emmy Award | image = | imagesize = | caption = San Francisco/Northern California Emmy Award | description = Excellence in [[television]] | presenter = [[National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences|NATAS]] | State = [[San Francisco, California]] | year = 1961 | website = http://www.emmysf.tv/ }}
The '''San Francisco/Northern California''' are a division of the [[National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences]]. The [[San Francisco, California]] division was founded in 1961. In addition to granting the San Francisco/Northern California [[Emmy Awards]], this division awards scholarships, honors industry veterans at the Silver Circle Celebration, conducts National Student Television Awards of Excellence, has a free research and a nationwide job bank. The chapter also participates in judging Emmy entries at the regional and national levels.<ref name="urlThe National Academy Of Television Arts & Sciences San Francisco/Northern California Chapter">{{cite web |url=http://www.emmysf.tv/grants.html |title="The National Academy Of Television Arts & Sciences San Francisco/Northern California Chapter" |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}} {{Dead link|date=November 2010|bot=H3llBot}}Grants and Scholarships</ref>
==Boundaries==
This academy is one of the largest chapters and is divided into the following boundaries and encompasses the states of [[California]], [[Visalia]], [[Oregon]], [[Hawaii]] and [[Reno, Nevada]]. These boundaries are responsible for the submission of television broadcast materials presented for awards considerations.<ref name="urlThe National Academy Of Television Arts & Sciences San Francisco/Northern California Chapter">{{cite web |url=http://www.emmysf.tv/about.html |title="The National Academy Of Television Arts & Sciences San Francisco/Northern California Chapter" |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}} {{Dead link|date=November 2010|bot=H3llBot}}Boundaries</ref>
==Board of governors==
The Board of Governors is a working board, which works together collaboratively to ensure they are providing for the best interests of the membership<ref name="urlThe National Academy Of Television Arts & Sciences San Francisco/Northern California Chapter">{{cite web |url=http://www.emmysf.tv/board.html |title="The National Academy Of Television Arts & Sciences San Francisco/Northern California Chapter" |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}} {{Dead link|date=November 2010|bot=H3llBot}}Board of Governors</ref>
==Emmy award winners==
Emmy award winners are individuals who show excellence in the field of television. The Emmys are held to the same esteem as the [[Oscar Awards]] are to motion pictures or the [[Grammy Awards]] are to the music industry.<ref name="urlemmysf.tv">{{cite web |url=http://emmysf.tv/pdf/Emmy10winpr.pdf |title=emmysf.tv |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-18}}Emmy award Winners</ref>
